description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 2a). Incipit: قال محمد هو ابن الجزرى يا ذا الجلال ارحمه واستر واغفر الحمد لله على ما يسره من نشر منقول حروف العشرة ... وبعد فالانسان ليس يشرف الا بما يحفظه ويعرف Explicit: وليسمح الوجه بها والحمد مع الصلوة قبله وبعد وههنا تمّ نظام الطيبة [105أ] الفية سعيدة مهذبه بالروم من شعبان وسط سنة تسع وتسعين وسبعمائة وقد اجزتها لكل مقري كذا اجزت كل من فى عصرى رواية يشرطها المعتبر وقاله محمد بن الجزرى يرحمه بفضله الرحمن فظنه من جوده الغفران 10 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red. Light cream paper with laid lines visible. Marginal annotations. Fol. 2 consists of two leaves pasted to one another. Short text on fol. 1a. Table of contents on fol. 1b. Table of abbreviations used in the text on fol. 2a. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Qirāʼāt 6". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 432". Certification of reading written by the author, dated 826 H. on fol. 105b. Copy completed on 5 Ramaḍān 826 [Aug. 12, 1423] by Muḥammad al-Qārī al-Rūdāwarī (colophon, fol. 105b).
author: Ibn al-Jazarī, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad, 1350-1429
abstract: Elegant copy of a treatise in verse on the ten readings of the Qurʼān. This copy contains an autograph ijāzah by the author (fol. 105b ; see mention at the end of the title, fol. 2a).
extent: i, 106, i leaves: paper ; 180 x 110 (135 x 70) mm. bound to 182 x 115 mm.
title: Kitāb Ṭayyibat al-nashr fī al-qirāʼāt al-ʻashr
creator: ابن الجزري، محمد بن محمد
subject: Qurʼan—Readings—Early works to 1800
binding note: Dark brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers, fore-edge flap and envelope flap. Silver tooling and stamping. Marbled paper pastedowns and free endpaper.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
